column1: #Text=[0004] When a LED is used as the light source of a lamp, heat generated from the LED should be effectively transferred to the exterior of the lamp because the LED diffuses a large amount of heat.
#Text=[0005] FIG. 1 illustrates a traditional general tubular LED lamp.

#Text=The housing of the lamp can be prepared by assembling a hemispherical heat radiation section and a hemispherical light transmission section, and a LED device and power supply, respectively, can be installed as the light source inside the housing.
#Text=[0006] Generally, the heat radiation section of the LED lamp housing may be prepared by die-casting a metal material having excellent heat conductivity, such as aluminum.
#Text=However, there can be problems associated with this process, such as high manufacturing costs and low productivity.
#Text=[0007] In addition, if the heat radiation section is prepared with metal materials, the weight of LED lamp can increase due to the weight of the metal materials.
#Text=This can render the LED lamp unsuitable as a home lamp.
#Text=[0008] The heat radiation section and the light transmission section can also be assembled by mechanical fastening methods.
#Text=This, however, can increase the likelihood of LED lamp malfunction due to penetration of moisture or/and water through the crack between connections.
